trans-unit.source: Defines configuration settings that are used to support the globalization infrastructure of Web applications.
This class cannot be inherited.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection> class provides a way to programmatically access and modify the content of the `globalization` section of the configuration file.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection"></xref> class by using default settings.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection.%23ctor%2A> constructor is not intended to be used directly from your code.
It is called by the ASP.NET configuration system.
You obtain an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection> class by using the <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.GetSection%2A> method.
Gets or sets a value specifying the default culture for processing incoming Web requests.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection.Culture%2A> property returns the default culture for processing incoming Web requests.
The default culture for processing incoming Web requests.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the best-fit character encoding for a response is enabled.
`true` if the best-fit character encoding for a response is enabled; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection.Culture"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection.UICulture"></xref> properties should be based on the <xref href="System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.AcceptLanguage"></xref> header field value that is sent by the client browser.

When the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection.EnableClientBasedCulture%2A> property is enabled, the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection.Culture%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection.UICulture%2A> properties are based on the <xref:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.AcceptLanguage> header field value that is sent by the client browser.

If the <xref:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.AcceptLanguage> header value cannot be mapped to a specific culture, the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection.Culture%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection.UICulture%2A> values are used.
The default value is `false`.

`true` if the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection.Culture"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection.UICulture"></xref> should be based on the <xref href="System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.AcceptLanguage"></xref> header field value sent by the client browser; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets a value specifying the default encoding for .aspx, .asmx, and .asax file parsing.

The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection.FileEncoding%2A> property specifies the default encoding that is used to interpret the data that is included in the .aspx, .asmx, and .asax file types.
If the file encoding is specified in the Web.config file, the actual file must be saved in the same encoding.

Unicode files and UTF-8 files that are saved with the byte order mark prefix <xref:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlUserDefinedTypeAttribute.IsByteOrdered%2A> property are automatically recognized regardless of the value of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection.FileEncoding%2A>.

If the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection.FileEncoding%2A> property setting for the server or application is configured to use UTF-16, and if UTF-16 is not the encoding that is used for an .aspx page in the scope of the configuration file, the output that is sent to the client browser is corrupted.
For this reason, ensure that the configured <xref:System.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection.FileEncoding%2A> value matches the encoding that is used in the .aspx page.
The default encoding value.
Gets or sets a value specifying the content encoding of HTTP requests.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection.RequestEncoding%2A> property specifies the assumed encoding of each incoming HTTP request, including posted data and query-string data.

If the request comes with a request header containing a <xref:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.ContentType> field, the <xref:System.Net.HttpRequestHeader.AcceptCharset> field of the request header overrides the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection.RequestEncoding%2A> of the configuration.
The default encoding is UTF-8, specified in the `globalization` section of the Machine.config file that was created when the .NET Framework was installed.

If the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection.RequestEncoding%2A> property is not specified in the Machine.config or Web.config file, encoding defaults to the `Regional Options` locale setting on the computer.

For single-server applications, the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection.RequestEncoding%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection.ResponseEncoding%2A> properties should be the same.

When using multiple server applications where the default server encodings are different, you can use local Web.config files to vary the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection.RequestEncoding%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection.ResponseEncoding%2A> properties.
The content encoding of HTTP requests.
The default is UTF-8.
Gets or sets the factory type of the resource provider.
The factory type of the resource provider.
Gets or sets a value specifying the content encoding of HTTP responses.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection.ResponseEncoding%2A> property gets or sets a value specifying the content encoding of HTTP responses.
The default encoding is UTF-8.
The content encoding of HTTP responses.
The default is UTF-8.
Gets or sets a value specifying the header encoding of HTTP responses.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection.ResponseHeaderEncoding%2A> property gets or sets a value specifying the header encoding of HTTP responses.
The default encoding is UTF-8.
The header encoding of HTTP responses.
The default is UTF-8.
Gets or sets a value specifying the default culture for processing locale-dependent resource searches.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.GlobalizationSection.UICulture%2A> property specifies the default culture for processing locale-dependent resource searches.
The default culture for processing locale-dependent resource searches.
